verses.verse: When a man<WH376> hath taken<WH3947> a wife<WH802>, and married<WH1166> her, and it come to pass that she find<WH4672> no favour<WH2580> in his eyes<WH5869>, because he hath found<WH4672> some<WH1697> uncleanness<WH6172> in her: then let him write<WH3789> her a bill<WH5612> of divorcement<WH3748>, and give<WH5414> it in her hand<WH3027>, and send<WH7971> her out of his house<WH1004>.
And when she is departed out<WH3318> of his house<WH1004>, she may go<WH1980> and be another<WH312> man's<WH376> wife.

And if the latter<WH314> husband<WH376> hate<WH8130> her, and write<WH3789> her a bill<WH5612> of divorcement<WH3748>, and giveth<WH5414> it in her hand<WH3027>, and sendeth<WH7971> her out of his house<WH1004>; or if the latter<WH314> husband<WH376> die<WH4191>, which took<WH3947> her to be his wife<WH802>;

Her former<WH7223> husband<WH1167>, which sent her away<WH7971>, may<WH3201> not take<WH3947> her again<WH7725> to be his wife<WH802>, after<WH310> that she is defiled<WH2930>; for that is abomination<WH8441> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>: and thou shalt not cause the land<WH776> to sin<WH2398>, which the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee for an inheritance<WH5159>.

¶ When a man<WH376> hath taken<WH3947> a new<WH2319> wife<WH802>, he shall not go out<WH3318> to war<WH6635>, neither shall he be charged<WH5674> with any business<WH1697>: but he shall be free<WH5355> at home<WH1004> one<WH259> year<WH8141>, and shall cheer up<WH8055> his wife<WH802> which he hath taken<WH3947>.
¶ No man shall take<WH2254> the nether<WH7347> or the upper millstone<WH7393> to pledge<WH2254>: for he taketh<WH2254> a man's life<WH5315> to pledge<WH2254>.

¶ If a man<WH376> be found<WH4672> stealing<WH1589> any<WH5315> of his brethren<WH251> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, and maketh merchandise<WH6014> of him, or selleth<WH4376> him; then that thief<WH1590> shall die<WH4191>; and thou shalt put<WH1197> evil<WH7451> away<WH1197> from among<WH7130> you.

¶ Take heed<WH8104> in the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883>, that thou observe<WH8104> diligently<WH3966>, and do<WH6213> according to all that the priests<WH3548> the Levites<WH3881> shall teach<WH3384> you: as I commanded<WH6680> them, so ye shall observe<WH8104> to do<WH6213>.
Remember<WH2142> what the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> did<WH6213> unto Miriam<WH4813> by the way<WH1870>, after that ye were come forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>.
¶ When thou dost lend<WH5383> thy brother<WH7453> any<WH3972> thing<WH4859>, thou shalt not go<WH935> into his house<WH1004> to fetch<WH5670> his pledge<WH5667>.
Thou shalt stand<WH5975> abroad<WH2351>, and the man<WH376> to whom thou dost lend<WH5383> shall bring out<WH3318> the pledge<WH5667> abroad<WH2351> unto thee.
And if the man<WH376> be poor<WH6041>, thou shalt not sleep<WH7901> with his pledge<WH5667>:

In any case<WH7725> thou shalt deliver<WH7725> him the pledge<WH5667> again<WH7725> when the sun<WH8121> goeth down<WH935>, that he may sleep<WH7901> in his own raiment<WH8008>, and bless<WH1288> thee: and it shall be righteousness<WH6666> unto thee before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.

¶ Thou shalt not oppress<WH6231> an hired servant<WH7916> that is poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34>, whether he be of thy brethren<WH251>, or of thy strangers<WH1616> that are in thy land<WH776> within thy gates<WH8179>:

At his day<WH3117> thou shalt give<WH5414> him his hire<WH7939>, neither shall the sun<WH8121> go down<WH935> upon it; for he is poor<WH6041>, and setteth<WH5375> his heart<WH5315> upon it: lest he cry<WH7121> against thee unto the LORD<WH3068>, and it be sin<WH2399> unto thee.

The fathers<WH1> shall not be put to death<WH4191> for the children<WH1121>, neither shall the children<WH1121> be put to death<WH4191> for the fathers<WH1>: every man<WH376> shall be put to death<WH4191> for his own sin<WH2399>.
¶ Thou shalt not pervert<WH5186> the judgment<WH4941> of the stranger<WH1616>, nor of the fatherless<WH3490>; nor take<WH2254> a widow's<WH490> raiment<WH899> to pledge<WH2254>:

But thou shalt remember<WH2142> that thou wast a bondman<WH5650> in Egypt<WH4714>, and the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> redeemed<WH6299> thee thence: therefore I command<WH6680> thee to do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>.

¶ When thou cuttest down<WH7114> thine harvest<WH7105> in thy field<WH7704>, and hast forgot<WH7911> a sheaf<WH6016> in the field<WH7704>, thou shalt not go again<WH7725> to fetch<WH3947> it: it shall be for the stranger<WH1616>, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>: that the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> thee in all the work<WH4639> of thine hands<WH3027>.
When thou beatest<WH2251> thine olive tree<WH2132>, thou shalt not go over the boughs<WH6286> again<WH310>: it shall be for the stranger<WH1616>, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>.

When thou gatherest<WH1219> the grapes of thy vineyard<WH3754>, thou shalt not glean<WH5953> it afterward<WH310>: it shall be for the stranger<WH1616>, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>.
And thou shalt remember<WH2142> that thou wast a bondman<WH5650> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: therefore I command<WH6680> thee to do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>.
